html: Jehovah’s creation here narrows from “nations” or “Gentiles” (goyim) to “isles” and “Lebanon,” which name denotes elite Israel (Isaiah 2:13; 10:34; Jeremiah 22:23; Ezekiel 17:3). Lebanon, moreover, forms the centerpiece of a mini-chiasm: the nations (v 15)—a; Lebanon (v 16)—b; and the nations (v 17)—a. In the intended end-time context of this passage, therefore, Jehovah’s people are seen to dwell among the nations, which accords with the exilic setting of this middle section of the Book of Isaiah (Isaiah 40-54). Chaos motifs are “drops,” “dust,” “specks,” “nothing,” and “chaos” or “ether” (tohu).
